source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Walls do in fact work. We have to make sure the job is complete. Unlike my opponent Mark Curran, I do not believe people should be rewarded for bad behavior. #NoAmnesty #BuildtheWall #DumpDurbin

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: The weather cooperated very nicely yesterday and I got to knock on some doors. Great conversations and it is clear: voters are tired of Dick Durbin taking advantage of the taxpayers. #TurnIllinoisRed

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Some critics say dividing up the state is a "out-of-the-box" idea that will be difficult to happen but what they fail to realize is that it is growing support everyday. In the campaign trail it is a consensus that Chicago politicians continue to take advantage of folks from downstate. I enjoyed going on the radio to discuss how to turn this plan into a reality. Read more here: https://www.wbez.org/shows/morning-shift/robert-marshalls-diagnosis-democrat-says-illinois-needs-to-be-divided-in-three/3b881a61-e583-4944-8827-5be3162d0c72

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: In my last run for public office I stood up to JB Pritzker and I warned him if he was going to buy the election and become the next governor that he should move away from supporting the progressive income tax plan. I guess he is already fed up with leading the state that he wants to be a one term governor by supporting this awful idea.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: I have always held consistent policy positions. One of those being totally against the progressive income tax. It is a fallacy that it will lead Illinois into prosperity, rather it will speed up the process in which people continue to move to places like Indiana. #NoNewTaxes #DumpDurbin

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: In plain English, this is dumb. We should not reverse history and we should also spend our time tackling issues that will make our students succeed. We need to keep our politicians accountable for foolish decisions like the one CPS made because something tells me they are not stopping until there is a change in all aspects of life.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: And it is not getting any better. It is time to get rid of Dick Durbin. 40+ years in politics is enough especially since there are so few accomplishments he can brag about. #KeepAmericaGreat https://www.illinoisreview.com/illinoisreview/2014/06/records-show-us-sen-dick-durbin-votes-against-taxpayers-97-of-the-time.html?fbclid=IwAR2kC3JtqkPr-pnym5D2y9dA-ReGKpe5FvzOBtmwpWbi0_IK22J2m-6Qsvg

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: He has a long way to go if he wants to catch up to career politician Dick Durbin, who has years of experience of getting gifts in exchange of supporting bad policies. #DumpDurbin

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: It is time to end these endless wars and bring back our American heroes. We also need to divide the state of Illinois. Check out the WTTW Candidate Guide to learn more about my policy positions at the link below. Together, we will beat Millionaire, Career Politician Dick Durbin.  https://news.wttw.com/elections/voters-guide/2020/candidates/illinois-senate/robert-marshall

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: This voter is also fed up with Dick Durbin.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: We are about 3 weeks away from the March Primary. Do you have $5, $10, or even $25 to spare? I will be hitting the airwaves and radio soon and want to make sure our team is able to send out an additional mailer. Donate today and help make a difference! No amount is too small.  Thank you! Bob

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate,St. Clair County Republican Party
text: JB Pritzker does not understand the fundamental idea that increasing taxes will not bring Illinois into prosperity. It will have the reverse effect with more people leaving Illinois.No No No on the not fair tax

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Another week in the books, another successful gun show. I am always happy to attend gun shows to talk to voters and discuss the important issues facing Conservatives. We can not let politicians infringe on our constitutional rights. Glad to have so many pro-gun allies!

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Had a fantastic time at the DuPage County Lincoln Day Dinner yesterday. Great conversation and even greater American patriots who are ready to win in November.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: We are just one week away from National Trump Day. Big shout out to Freedom Movement USA for helping organize this great day and for their past involvement in setting up previous Trump Rallies.  Two things I love about Trump rallies:  1) the tremendous support shown by Americans across the state 2) running into fellow Vietnam Veterans like my friend pictured below. #NationalTrumpDay

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Tune into Black and Right in 30 minutes on AM 560 The Answer. I enjoy listening to J Anthony Speaks every Saturday along with the group of fantastic conservatives that talk about important issues facing our society.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Support for Donald J. Trump comes in all shapes and sizes- this is awesome!

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: We are only 175 days until the kick-off of the 2020 Illinois State Fair, but who is counting? After over a year of a phony witch hunt and a Do Nothing Congress I am more than certain that on Republican Day we will have a strong army of support for President Trump and all the Republican candidates down ballot.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Happy President's Day! I hope you get to chance to honor the great individuals who have made an everlasting impact on our great nation.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Donald J.Trump would agree: It is time to divide Illinois into smaller states. This would allow better government and better Republican representation in the United State Senate. We have to take the necessary steps to make this a reality and I am 100% committed into ensuring this becomes a reality.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Finished off a very healthy debate on issues facing Illinois and how a Republican Senator can tackle these issues. Hats off to Mikhail Essa, founder of the Hinsdale Central Conservative Group. Great to see young people engaged in the political process.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Happy belated birthday to one of the greatest Presidents this nation has ever had. Had a great time in Springfield last night as Sangamon County hosted yet another successful Lincoln Day Dinner. What a way to honor Lincoln's legacy!

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Immigration should be based on three factors. Read what they are below in the Daily Herald's candidate profile.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: "Dr. Marshall has floated his three-state solution for years, but he says social issues are the focus of his latest run". It is time downstate gets the resources it deserves. I am a proponent of dividing up the state, which will give Republicans a greater voice in Washington.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: While one of my opponents can continue to send one of her goons to defend her lies, I have been a vocal supporter of President Trump. I have attended numerous rallies both here in Illinois and out of state and have done my part and contributed to President Trump's re-election campaign. None of my primary opponents were at his only Chicago fundraiser. I, however, had the privilege to hear him speak and show why we need four more years of his presidency.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Read my statement regarding the poorly vetted Secretary of State's automatic voter registration program

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Had a great time talking to the Chicago Sun Times discussing the need to bring back the Senate seat to someone looking out for the best interests of the hardworking residents. Take a look at some of my answers in the link below.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate,Peggy Hubbard Watch
text: I have had the pleasure to be in several events, endorsement sessions, and debates with a distinguished group of people. From former office holders to a fellow doctor, there is no doubt great respect among each other and we will support who gets the nominee. That will not happen if Peggy Hubbard wins the primary. All credit goes to the creators of Peggy Hubbard Watch who have shined a light on why Peggy would be disastrous for our Republican Party. I do not take back anything I said in this video. The amount of lies she spews is not normal for a toddler let alone a U.S. Senate candidate. Let us make sure we choose wisely on March 17. God Bless!Peggy Hubbard, who voted for Barack Hussein Obama twice, and claims now to be a Conservative, was called out today for LYING about her opponents and for her inability to control her dirty mouth. Why? Becuase she is a democrat.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: I had a great time at the 7th Annual Downers Grove Township Republican Organization Reagan Day Dinner. I got the chance to discuss some of my policy positions to fantastic patriots, but the best part of the day was getting to listen to Stephen Moore discuss why Trump's economy is working for the middle class and how he has been able to deliver on the promises he made. It is crucial we re-elect President Trump to four more years. #KeepAmericaGreat #Trump2020

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Got no plans right now? Watch me and fellow Republican Senatorial candidates of Illinois discuss our platform for you to decide who can best take on Dick Durbin. We are live now! Click on the link below for a live stream of our debate. Thank you!  https://www.dailyherald.com/news/20200124/watch-gop-candidates-for-us-senate-square-off-live-on-dailyheraldcom

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Happy Martin Luther King JR Day! Unlike today's environment Dr. King taught us the importance of civility, but most importantly the necessary task of fighting for the civil rights for all Americans. I pledge to do so in the United States Senate: from those living in the inner-city to the unborn, everyone deserves full rights as an American.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: I had a great time at Northwest Side GOP Club's fundraiser. We Republicans should be forever grateful for Ammie Terrell-Kessem and the NWSGOP Club for their nonstop dedication to ensuring Republicans have a voice in Chicago. Ammie is going to be a phenomenal choice as the 41st Ward Committeeman who will help our party grow.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Had a great time at the Cook County State Central Committee Meeting where I got the chance to discuss my priorities as United States Senator for Illinois. A great turnout. No doubt people are fired up to re-elect President Trump and dump Career Politican Dick Durbin out of office.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Yesterday evening I officially filed to be a Republican candidate for the United States Senate. Turning over 7,000 signatures was no easy feat. I want to congratulate my opponents Mark Curran for U.S. Senate, Peggy Hubbard, and others on accomplishing this task. Let's make our party proud and have a spirited and professional primary to give voters the opportunity to best pick the candidate that can defeat Dick Durbin.

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: I had a blast speaking to the Champaign County Republican Party. A lot of enthusiasm and I know we are ready to win in 2020! #DumpDurbin

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: It was a pleasure to speak to such an amazing group of Patriots! No matter who wins the primary we must unite and show how strong we are to defeat Dick Durbin. I will continue to go to any county to tell voters why I am the best candidate to defeat Durbin. Have a great Sunday everyone!

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate
text: Congratulation to Willie Wilson on stepping up to the challenge of taking on Career Politician Dick Durbin! Should I win the GOP nomination I look forward to a healthy debate on who can best represent Illinois in the United States Senate.  Read my full statement below:

source: Robert Marshall, Republican for U.S. Senate,Jim Hawkins,Republican Assembly of Lake County
shared_from: Jim Hawkins,Republican Assembly of Lake County
text: It was a pleasure to speak to the Lake County Republicans. The enthusiasm to support Republicans is high and we must continue to build on it to #DumpDurbin and secure President Trump's re-election. #KeepAmericaGreat!RALC meeting July 18, 2019:  Dr. Robert Marshall, a U.S. Senate candidate

text: My name is Dr. Robert Marshall and I hope to gain your support to win the Republican Primary for U.S. Senate and take on Dick Durbin. Please visit my website or follow me on Twitter for more information! I look forward to seeing you on the campaign trail.
